image_copyright: © Peter Milton / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York
markings: edition number LLC; two embossed stamps LLC
medium: Resist-ground etching and engraving, and direct photographic transfer
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn. (until d. 2012); by descent to his daughter Catherine Andrus, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: signed and dated in pencil LR corner
text: Upon learning that he was colorblind, Peter Milton turned from painting to black and white printmaking. His intricate images combine detailed observation of light and form, often layering multiple moments in long spans of time to create, as it seems here, portraits of memory.
title: Daylilies
